freenet.l10n
Class NodeL10n

java.lang.Object
  freenet.l10n.NodeL10n

public class NodeL10n
extends Object

This is the interface used to localize the Node. It just wraps a BaseL10n with correct parameters so that this class can entierly be used using static methods, which is much more practical to use than non-static methods. Why doesn't that class extends BaseL10n ? Because it has to be static. How to change the language ? Simply create a new NodeL1On object. You don't have to stock the created object because you can access it using static methods.

Author:
Artefact2
